Since whitespace cannot be contained in an URI, certain tool (such as xerces) would normalize the URI first before trying to open an URL connection.  However, if the project name contains a whitespace (eg. "a b") in it, PlatformURLResourceConnection.resolve always fails on the normalized URI (complaining project "a%20b" does not exist):

java.io.IOException: Project: a%20b does not exist.  Could not resolve URL: platform:/resource/a%20b/xml/test.xml.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.PlatformURLResourceConnection.resolve(PlatformURLResourceConnection.java)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformURLHandler.openConnection(PlatformURLHandler.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.protocol.URLStreamHandlerProxy.openConnection(URLStreamHandlerProxy.java)
	at java.net.URL.openConnection(URL.java:924)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLEntityManager.setupCurrentEntity(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLVersionDetector.determineDocVersion(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse(Unknown Source)
	...

There might be no easy way for us to workaround this problem (because we are not the one nomralizing the URL) except to switch the platform URL to file URL.

Fix

The URL class never decodes escape sequences, so we have to use URLDecoder here to convert back to a platform path.
+1 to applying this in the 3.2.2 stream.
Fix and automated test released to HEAD (3.3 stream). Targetting 3.2.2.
